description: Implemented OAuth2 authentication with rate limiting, achieving 40% latency reduction
fullContent:
# OAuth2 Implementation

## Overview
This week, I led the implementation of OAuth2 authentication for our API gateway. This initiative aimed to replace our legacy session-based auth with a modern token-based approach.

## Technical Approach
I designed a token-based authentication flow using Redis for session storage and implemented refresh token rotation for enhanced security. The implementation included rate limiting to prevent abuse and comprehensive logging for debugging.

## Outcomes
The implementation resulted in a 40% reduction in API latency due to the stateless nature of JWT tokens. We successfully migrated all existing users with zero downtime and achieved 95% test coverage on the new auth module.

phases.name: Design & Planning
phases.summary: Designed auth flow and created technical spec in Confluence

phases.name: Implementation
phases.summary: Implemented OAuth2 flow with Redis token storage

Technical spec approval from architecture review
